\end{definition}

\begin{corollary} Suppose that $f: {\Bbb Z}_p^d \to {\mathbb C}$. Then the (coarse) bandwidth (dimension) of $f$ is $0$ if and only if $f$ is a constant. \end{corollary}

Our next result characterizes which indicator functions of sets are eigenfunctions of the Fourier transform. 
In other words, it studies sets $E \subset {\Bbb Z}_p^d$ such that $\widehat{E}(m)=\lambda E(m)$ for some constant $\lambda \in {\mathbb C}$. We shall refer to such sets as self Fourier dual.
